New Records: Abhishek Sharma became the fastest Indian to score a T20I century in terms of innings, achieving the milestone in only his second international match.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored a half-century to help India reach 182/4.
Washington Sundar took three wickets, restricting Zimbabwe to 159/6.
Dion Myers scored his first T20I half-century for Zimbabwe.
India won the match by 23 runs, leading the five-match series 2-1.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill decided to bat first after winning the toss, hoping the moisture would help them.
Sikandar Raza mentioned that they would have bowled first regardless of the toss result, expecting seamers to come into play and some slow turn.
Post-Match Reflections: Yashasvi Jaiswal expressed enjoyment and satisfaction with the partnerships and total score achieved by India.
Shivam Dube emphasized the importance of expressing himself in all departments and maintaining a cool and calm atmosphere in the dressing room.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch had some grass rolled into it and cracks indicating it was dry, making it a good batting surface initially but tricky in the second innings.
India's fielding and bowling were noted to be sloppy at times, giving Zimbabwe some opportunities.
